Serge Hefez, psychiatrist: 'Our children are too alone in front of screens'
subhead: The teenager who stabbed a school supervisor in eastern France in June had no history of mental health problems and later showed no remorse. Psychoanalyst Serge Hefez draws a link between the growing lack of empathy he has observed in his patients and their ever-increasing screen time.

headline: Biggest-ever Budapest Pride defies Orban ban in Hungary
subhead: Budapest Pride began under heavy police surveillance and international scrutiny. Organizers estimated up to 200,000 people took part in the parade in the Hungarian capital.

headline: Paris's Iranian diaspora debates war, mullahs and 'what comes next' at city bookshop
subhead: After Israel's and then America's airstrikes on Iran, the Iranian editor and theater director Tinouche Nazmjou launched a series of discussions at his bookshop in the 15th arrondissement.

headline: Pontus Hult√©n, the Swede who created Paris's Centre Pompidou
subhead: Hult√©n, the director of the National Museum of Modern Art from 1973 to 1981, saw art as a means of changing the world. He spearheaded the Centre Pompidou project in Paris, elevating it to the rank of an international institution. A new exhibition at the Grand Palais celebrates the deep friendship that bound this talent scout to Niki de Saint Phalle and Jean Tinguely.

headline: Syringe attacks at France-wide music event: How panic spread on social media
